business.headline: Technicolor India shuts down, over 3,000 employees affected The company currently employs 3,200 people across India, with nearly 3,000 in Bengaluru alone. The sudden move has left several employees in shock.

RuPay Debit Select Card: Check new features effective from April 1, 2025RuPay Debit Select Cardholders can enjoy one complimentary domestic airport lounge visit each quarter and two international lounge visits a year at participating lounges (conditions apply).

India needs tariff cuts, reforms to boost investments: World Bank The World Bank report titled 'Economic Memorandum India' also highlights that for India to become a high-income country by 2047, its per capita income must grow nearly eight times current levels.

What's your best asset in 20s? Not stocks or trading, says Radhika GuptaRadhika Gupta cautioned that young professionals might be focusing on passive income too early. She believes that the best investment in your 20s is not stocks or trading but your talent and time.

Smallcap, midcap indices set for worst month in 5 years. More pain ahead?In 2025 so far, mid-cap stocks have fallen 16%, while small-cap stocks have slumped 21%. In comparison, the benchmark Nifty 50 is down 6.7%.

NPCI introduces UPI Lite's 'Transfer Out' feature. All details hereAll issuer banks and UPI Apps must implement the required changes by March 31, 2025, as mentioned in NPCI's circular dated February 21, 2025

EPFO retains 8.25% interest rate on provident fund deposits for 2024-25In February 2024, the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) had increased the interest rate on EPF marginally to 8.25 per cent for 2023-24, from 8.15 per cent in 2022-23.

Explained: Why IT stocks like TCS, Infosys, Tech Mahindra are falling todayTech Mahindra was the biggest loser among IT stocks, down nearly 5.5% at the time publishing this report. Wipro was also down nearly 5%. Major IT firms such as TCS, Infosys and HCLTech were also down nearly 4% each.

Portfolio in red? Top mutual funds to consider amid stock market downturnInvestors are now looking for safer investment options as the markets have seen a huge correction. Mutual funds that balance risk and growth are a preferred choice among many.

Explained: Why Premier Energies shares tumbled up to 8% today The company's share price fell to a day's low of Rs 850 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). At around 12 pm, shares of Premier Energies were down 4.46% to Rs 881.80.

Ever heard of an alimony calculator? Here's how it worksAn alimony calculator is a tool that helps in determining the estimated financial support one spouse may need to pay the other after a divorce or separation.
India, EU agree to push for conclusion of free trade pact this yearThe EU is India's biggest trade partner in goods, with trade hitting $137.5 billion in 2023-24, nearly doubling in ten years.
Meta fires 20 employees for leaking internal information to mediaThe latest round of firings came following a recent series of reports based on Mark Zuckerberg's meetings with employees.

Stock market crash: 5 things investors should know as Sensex plunges 1,400 pointsStock market crash: Retail investors, already grappling with losses, are left wondering whether this correction will continue or if a recovery is on the horizon. Here are 5 things investors need to know
Sensex crashes 1,400 points: Why stock market is falling todayAt 12:53 PM, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 1,371.42 points at 73,241.01, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 421.15 points to 22,123.90.

Bitcoin tumbles 5% to fall below $80,000 for first time since NovemberThe decline comes amid uncertainty over US President Donald Trump's trade policies, regulatory decisions on cryptocurrency, and concerns among investors after a major hack in rival digital currency ether.

Sensex plunges nearly 1,000 points, Nifty tumbles over 1%; IT, auto stocks bleedThe S&P BSE Sensex lost nearly 977.03 points to 73,635.40 at 10:06 am, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 303.60 points to 22,241.45 at 10:06 am.

Karnataka labour department finds no law violation in Infosys layoffs: ReportThe final report is expected to be submitted within a week, and a copy will also be sent to the Union labour department for further review.

Who is Tuhin Kanta Pandey? A look at his key roles in the governmentThe Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC) has approved Tuhin Kanta Pandey's appointment for a term of three years. He is a 1987-batch Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer from the Odisha cadre.

Tuhin Kanta Pandey appointed new Sebi Chairman, to succeed Madhabi Puri BuchTuhin Kanta Pandey, the current Finance Secretary, has been appointed as the new Chairman of market regulator Sebi. He will succeed Madhabi Puri Buch.

Amazon India hit with $39 million penalty for apparel trademark violationThe lawsuit was filed by Lifestyle Equities, the owner of the Beverly Hills Polo Club (BHPC) horse trademark. It claimed that Amazon India was selling apparel with a similar logo at lower prices.

Fixed vs floating interest rates: Which option to choose?Floating home loan interest rates are usually lower than fixed rates. Hence, they are more appealing when rates are likely to dip or stay stable.
Sensex, Nifty end flat despite banking and financial sector boostThe S&P BSE Sensex added 10.31 points to close at 74,612.43, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 2.50 points to end at 22,545.05.
Sensex, Nifty end flat despite banking and financial sector boostThe S&P BSE Sensex added 10.31 points to close at 74,612.43, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 2.50 points to end at 22,545.05.
Why NPS should be a part of your retirement plan? 5 things to knowWhen compared to fixed deposits (FDs) and Public Provident Funds (PPF), NPS offers superior returns over the long run.

Explained: Why NBFC stocks may offer stability in choppy marketsThe RBI's decision to ease certain loan rules and delay stricter regulations on capital requirements has improved sentiment in the financial sector. This has made NBFC stocks attractive options for investors.

Bitcoin sees 10% drop this week: 5 reasons behind the fallThe largest crypto has witnessed a decline of more than 10% over the last seven days. This downward trend comes amid US President Donald Trump's aggressive trade policies and EU tariff threats.

Government seeks to cut states' share of central taxes: ReportBased on the expected tax collections for the ongoing financial year, a 1% swing in the states' share of tax revenue could give the central government about Rs 3,500 crore.

Sensex, Nifty tumble 4% this month: Should share market investors be worried? Brokerage firm Emkay Global said falling prices make market investors nervous, but there are good signs too. The RBI lowering risk for NBFCs and micro-borrowers helps, and Nifty is now priced better at around 22,500.
Infosys trainees complain to PM's Office over 'forceful' layoffs: ReportThe employees have sought intervention to be reinstated in their jobs and to prevent similar terminations in the future.

Trump Gold Card Visa: 5 key things you need to knowUS President Donald Trump believes the new visa will attract wealthy individuals to the US who will spend large sums, pay high taxes, and boost the economy.

Explained: Why Nuvama cut Spicejet share price target despite profit in Q3SpiceJet attributed its Q3 performance to strong passenger demand, better efficiency, and smarter pricing. In the third quarter, the company's revenue jumped 35% to Rs 1,651 crore, and occupancy stayed at 87%.

Paytm partners with Perplexity for AI-powered search feature on appPaytm says this move is to keep up with growing digital demand. The AI search will work in local languages, making it easier for people to use.
Explained: Why UltraTech Cement shares fell 6% todayUltraTech Cement Ltd shares fell 6%. The stock opened at Rs 10,796.15 after having closed at Rs 10,968.45 in the previous session.
Why RBI Bank, Bandhan Bank, AU Small Finance Bank shares are rising today? Shares of RBL Bank, Bandhan Bank, AU Small Finance Bank, IDFC First Bank, and IndusInd Bank gained up to 7%.

Do you have multiple UANs? Here's how to merge them Every time you join a new company, give your employer the existing UAN so they don't create another. If they've already made a new one, you need to merge it with your old one.

5 PSU banks may see government stake sale of up to 20%: ReportThe government is working on a plan in consultation with the Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM), the Department of Financial Services (DFS), and state-run banks.
Sensex, Nifty open higher as banking and financial stocks gain in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 115.61 points to 74,717.73, while the NSE Nifty50 added37.30 points to 22,584.85 as of 9:20 AM.

Stock market today: Top 3 stocks that could deliver good return in near term Since peaking at an all-time high in September last year, Dalal Street has seen nearly a 12% correction, leading investors to search for stocks that could offer gains despite market uncertainty.

Best place to invest: Why is World Bank bullish on India despite FII sell-off?World Bank Country Director Auguste Tano Kouame, while speaking at the Advantage Assam 2.0 Business Summit, dismissed concerns over the recent market downturn and reaffirmed confidence in India's growth.

entertainment.headline: Ek Badnaam Aashram 3 part 2 review: Baba Nirala's journey meets a dramatic endReleased-Thu Feb 27, 2025Prakash Jha's most anticipated series, Aashram Season 3 Part 2, is currently streaming on MX Player. The series focusses on Baba Nirala's fate and how his entire kingdom crashes down because of Pammi's quest for revenge.

Dabba Cartel review: Shabana Azmi and gang tap into a challenging worldReleased-Fri Feb 28, 2025'Dabba Cartel' is supposed to be a powerful story of five women who team up to run a cartel in Mumbai. But, the Netflix series ends up becoming a mushy pie.

G-Dragon's Übermensch album is out: A long-overdue masterpieceK-pop King G-Dragon is back with a new album after over a decade. Titled Übermensch, the album is a long-overdue masterpiece the fans deserved.

Japanese woman summoned for kissing BTS' Jin without consentA Japanese woman has been summoned by the South Korean police after she kissed BTS member Jin without his consent during a fan event held last summer.

Suzhal The Vortex 2 review: This crime-drama is trapped in the vortex of clichesReleased-Fri Feb 28, 2025Suzhal - The Vortex 2 review: Created by Pushkar and Gayatri, Suzhal - The Vortex 2 is a crime drama that suffers from overstuffed ideas. The show has interesting ideas, but it gets lost in the overstretched screenplay.

Meghan Markle discusses food, music and Korea in new glimpse of 'With Love, Meghan'Meghan Markle and chef Roy Choi bond over food and the culture of South Korea as they discuss Karoake bars and music in the new promo for her Netflix show, 'With Love, Meghan'.

Composer Pritam thanks Mumbai Police for arresting studio theft culpritMusic composer Pritam expressed gratitude towards the Mumbai Police for capturing the suspect involved in a Rs 40 lakh theft from his studio. He praised their efforts in a heartfelt Instagram post.

The Boys 5: Supernatural actors Jensen Ackles, Jared Padalecki to reuniteThe Boys Season 5 will be an exciting reunion as Soldier Boy Jensen Ackles will be joined by his Supernatural co-stars Jared Padalecki and Misha Collins.

Suits LA review: Sass, swag and secrets in a soggy spin-offReleased-Mon Feb 24, 2025'Suits LA' has the flavour of the original 'Suits', but Teddy Black is no Harvey Spector, and you will be reminded of it, despite all the pizazz in the show.

Oscar-nominated Savan Kotecha to find India's first global boy bandSavan Kotecha is launching a nationwide hunt for India's first global boy band. Partnering with Universal Music, he aims to build a teen pop economy and create Indian stars for the world stage.

Undercover High School review: Korean 'Main Hoon Na' with more thrillsReleased-Fri Feb 21, 2025Undercover High School review: It is a thrilling Korean series blending action and comedy, reminiscent of 'Main Hoon Na', where a disgraced spy navigates high school challenges while on a mission to find missing gold.

O Saathi Re: Imtiaz Ali's Netflix series is a modern story with a vintage heartNetflix has released the first look of its new series O Saathi Re, starring Avinash Tiwary, Aditi Rao Hydari, and Arjun Rampal. The series, directed by Arif Ali, will be an 'ode to vintage love in modern times'.

general news.headline: 47 feared trapped after avalanche hits Uttarakhand's BadrinathThe avalanche occurred near the BRO site between Mana village and Mana Pass where the workers were engaged in clearing snow from the road to facilitate army movement.

500 cops, dog squads, drones: How Pune rape accused was caughtPune rape accused Dattatray Ramdas Gade was caught following a three-day manhunt after a man at whose house the former went to seek water tipped him off to the police. He was hiding at a farm in Shirur at the time of arrest.

Normalcy in Kashmir forced, not organic: Omar Abdullah jabs CentreOmar Abdullah said the security situation in Kashmir was far from 'normal' as indicated by the closure of Jamia Masjid in Srinagar on Shab-e-Baraat.

Match of the Century: When the Cold War was fought on 64 squaresThe 1972 showdown between Russian chess grandmaster Boris Spassky and American grandmaster Bobby Fischer, which was dubbed the 'Match of the Century', and was played at the peak of the Cold War. Spassky, who fought the Cold War for the Soviets against the American Fischer on the 64-square board, died on Thursday.

Actors Kiara Advani, Sidharth Malhotra announce pregnancy: Greatest gift of our livesActors and celebrity couple, Kiara Advani and Sidharth Malhotra, are expecting their first child. The happy news was shared by Advani on her social media handle on Friday.

Agra IT firm employee dies by suicide, accuses wife of affair in videoThe victim's father has filed a complaint against his daughter-in-law. No arrests have been made yet. The incident has drawn comparisons to the recent suicide case of Atul Subhash in Bengaluru.

No ICU in 14 Delhi hospitals, mohalla clinics without toilets: CAG reportThe audit report has exposed severe lapses in Delhi's healthcare system, citing shortages of staff, equipment, and infrastructure, alongside mismanagement of emergency funds under the previous AAP government.

28 stitches in private parts: Girl, 5, battles for life after rape in GwaliorThe 5-year-old girl was hospitalised with extensive wounds, and her private parts sustained severe damage. She underwent major surgery, which required 28 stitches to her genital area.

Bridging borders with fashion, courtesy Hania Aamir and Tara SutariaThis time, yet again, fashion has managed to bridge borders, and at the forefront of it this time are none other than Hania Aamir and Tara Sutaria.
5 killed, dozens wounded in bombing at mosque in northwest Pakistan The blast took place at a mosque in Akkora Khattak district of northwestern Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province.

Supreme Court reinstates 2 women judges: Termination was stigmatic in natureNoting that one of the judges had to be hospitalised due to Covid-19 and then suffered a miscarriage, the Supreme Court said the High Court should have been more sensitive to the situation.

Kangana Ranaut, Javed Akhtar settle defamation case: He has been kind, graciousKangana Ranaut and Javed Akhtar have settled their five-year-long defamation case. Kangana shared a picture with Akhtar, calling him "kind and gracious" as they resolved the matter in court.

Gene Hackman-wife's death mystery: 911 audio, police statement, all that happened The 911 call details of Gene Hackman and his wife Betsy Arakawa's death have been released. Police in their statement revealed that the manner and cause of death have not been determined.

Comatose Indian student's family gets US visa after repeated rejectionsThe family of Neelam Shinde, a student from Maharashtra's Satara district who is currently battling for her life in an American hospital after suffering critical injuries in a road accident, has received a visa to visit her in the US.

MK Stalin rallies against Hindi imposition, lauds support from Punjab, TelanganaTamil Nadu CM MK Stalin, in a video message to DMK cadre,  accused the Centre of withholding funds over language policy, while praising Punjab and Telangana for mandating regional languages in schools.

Non-stop rain and snowfall in Himachal: Roads shut, power cut, landslide in KulluSnowfall continues in Lahaul-Spiti even after three days. In several areas, over three feet of snow has accumulated, and there also remains a risk of avalanches, said officials.

Preity Zinta responds to question on filing defamation case against Rahul GandhiActor Preity Zinta recently conducted an AskMe session on X where she responded to some of the questions posed by her fans. SS Rajamouli's friend accuses him of 'harassment': This is my dying declarationA 'dying declaration' video of SS Rajamouli's close friend Uppalapati Srinivasa Rao is doing the rounds on social media. He accused the RRR filmmaker of 'ruining his career' and 'harassing' him.

RRR win to Will Smith slap: 5 viral moments from Oscars in last five yearsThe Oscars 2025 ceremony is upon us, and it only seems fitting to do a quick recap of the awards night's viral moments in the last five years. Oscars 2025 will be held on March 3 (IST).

sports.headline: Shubman Gill ends injury speculation, trains for 2 hours ahead of IND vs NZ clashShubman Gill ended speculation around his participation in the India vs New Zealand clash as he trained for 2 hours in Dubai on Thursday, February 27. Gill was the only one to miss the practice session on February 26, and he decided to spend some time in the nets on Thursday.

Virat Kohli eyes multiple Sachin Tendulkar records in New Zealand clashChampions Trophy 2025: Virat Kohli will be nearing a couple of records of Sachin Tendulkar when India lock horns with New Zealand in the last Group A match on February 28 at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

How Virat Kohli reworked his batting after Australia tour: Sanjay Bangar revealsFormer India batting coach Sanjay Bangar revealed how Virat Kohli was able to work on his batting technique after the Australia tour. Kohli scored a hundred during India's match against Pakistan in Dubai.

PCB announces PSL 2025 schedule, clashes with IPL 2025PSL 2025: The Pakistan Super League 2025 will take place from April 11 to May 18, clashing with the Indian Premier League to be staged from March 22 to May 25.

IND vs NZ: Shubman Gill trains on off day before New Zealand clashShubman Gill decided to step up his preparations for the New Zealand game by training on an official off day. There was speculation about Gill's availability after he missed India's practice session on February 26.

Lewis Hamilton features on TIME magazine cover, reveals why he chose FerrariAhead of the start of the F1 2025 season, Lewis Hamilton has been featured on the cover of the TIME Magazine. Hamilton will be racing for Ferrari in the new season after making the switch from Mercedes.

Harry Brook my choice to be next England captain, but be careful: Nasser HussainNasser Hussain said that Harry Brook would be his choice to replace Jos Buttler as the next England white-ball captain. However, Hussain said that England will need to be careful while appointing Brook as captain and explained the reason behind it.

Watch: MS Dhoni and R Ashwin reunited as CSK amp up IPL 2025 preparationsCSK fans were given a dose of nostalgia by the franchise as MS Dhoni and R Ashwin reunited during the training camp ahead of the IPL 2025 campaign. Ashwin returned to the franchise after a gap of 7 years.

Rana Sanaullah, advisor to Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif, has said that the PM will take notice of this embarrassing loss.

Lahore rain and Australia threaten Afghanistan's historic semi-final bidAfghanistan once again meet Australia in a high-octane match at an ICC event. This time, Australia stand in their way of reaching the semi-final of the Champions Trophy. Apart from Australia, Afghanistan will also be fighting fate, as inclement weather threatens to spoil their run in the tournament.

Gujarat captain Ashleigh Gardner was adjudged Player of the Match for her match-winning half-century.

Laureus withdraws Sinner's Sportsman of the Year nomination over doping banThe Laureus Academy has withdrawn World No.1 tennis player Jannik Sinner's nomination for this year's Sportsman of the Year award. The Academy let its decision known via a press release on Thursday, February 27.

Butcher slams 'arrogant' England team: Everybody wants to see them loseFormer England players Mark Butcher and Alex Hartley have slammed the arrogance of the England side. Butcher has claimed that everyone wants to see England lose because of the team's arrogance on and off the field.

India's advantage in Dubai puts more pressure on them: Rassie van der DussenSouth Africa batter Rassie van der Dussen said that India would be under more pressure in the knockout stages of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 to make the most of their advantage in Dubai.

Afghanistan vs Australia, all you need to know: Lahore pitch report, live streamingAfghanistan and Australia will face-off in one of the most anticipated fixtures of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 on Friday, February 28 at Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore. The winner of the fixture will qualify for the semi-finals of the tournament.

Champions Trophy: Which is the 2nd best ODI team in Asia?Two Asian teams - Bangladesh and Pakistan, have already been knocked out of the Champions Trophy 2025. Are the Asian ODI teams in decline? If India is the best ODI team in the continent, who is the second best? Kingshuk and Rishabh discuss in the Clash of Champions.

Asia Cup 2025 in September, likely to be played at a neutral venue in T20 formatThe 17th edition of the Asia Cup is likely to be played in T20 format. UAE is set to host the tournament as the Asian Cricket Council is keen on picking a neutral venue for the continental tournament.

Australia are wary of Afghanistan's spin and pace threat: Marnus LabuschagneAustralia batter Marnus Labuschagne acknowledged Afghanistan's threat in all three departments and said that their batters will especially work on negating their spinners in the middle overs. Australia will take on Afghanistan in their last group game of the Champions Trophy on Friday, February 28.

Meet Faryal Waqar: The viral Pakistani cricket fan who admires Virat Kohli In an exclusive interview with India Today, Faryal Waqar opened up about the whirlwind of attention she has received over the past few days after a video of her reaction to the India vs Pakistan game in Dubai went viral. Faryal, a fan of Mohammad Rizwan and Virat Kohli, bore a striking resemblance to Bollywood star Deepika Padukone.

Privilege to be compared to Deepika Padukone, says viral Pakistani cricket fanChampions Trophy 2025: It wasn't just her reaction that caught everyone's attention. Several cricket fans on social media pointed out that Faryal Waqar resembled Bollywood actors of the likes of Deepika Padukone and Kriti Sanon.

Jasprit Bumrah starts bowling at NCA, posts training videoIndia pacer Jasprit Bumrah began bowling at the National Cricket Academy in Bengaluru. Bumrah has not played any form of cricket since Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2024/25.

Gavaskar takes a dig at Harry Brook after England's exit: Are lights in Lahore ok?Legendary India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar took a dig at Harry Brook following England's exit from the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 after their defeat to Afghanistan in Lahore.

IND vs PAK bilateral cricket only resume under one condition: GavaskarIndia and Pakistan cannot play bilateral series without solving border issues, said Sunil Gavaskar. Speaking on Pakistani YouTube channel Sports Central, Gavaskar candidly shared his views on the sensitive matter.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.
